Mindful Practices: Integrating SEL into Your Classroom

About This Course

This course offers support and guidance in the Educator’s journey of integrating Social-Emotional Learning (SEL) and mindfulness into the classroom. You will explore structured activities to help your students understand their emotions, improve their focus, manage stress, and regulate their behavior. You will leave with a solid foundation about the "why" behind SEL and gain practical strategies for implementation with your students.

Course Objectives

Educators who engage with this series will describe:

  • How to support the growth of SEL competencies for their students.
  • How to create safe spaces for their students to practice SEL, during both instructional and non-instructional time.
  • SEL and Mindfulness strategies that are relevant and trauma-informed.
  • How to create a supportive classroom climate of "respect and rapport" to decrease student and teacher stress/anxiety and to increase student achievement.
  • How to recognize the correlation between educators' own social-emotional competence (SEC) and its influences on the behavior of their students.

Educators who engaged with this series will differentiate:

    • Between effective classroom management and effective SEL practices.

Course Outline

Module 1:
POP Check

In this module we invite you to experience a POP Check while applying split-vision: think about how you could use POP Checks for your own self-care as well as how you could use them with students.

Module 2:
Introduction to SEL

This module provides a solid introduction to social-emotional learning (SEL). Learn about the Why of SEL and understand how it is based upon a foundation of safety and structure. 

Module 3:
SEL Competencies and Experiential Practices

This module explores CASEL’s first three SEL competencies through experiential practices designed for students and adults to integrate into the classroom.

Module 4:
SEL Structures and Routines in the Classroom

By defining what managing your students’ behavior is vs. what SEL is, this module helps educators create a clearly defined set of expectations and routines.

Grading

To receive full completion for this course, you'll need to view all of the pages and finish all activities. You can check your grades after each lesson by going to "Course Links" at the top of the course and selecting "Grades" from the drop-down options.

SCECH Information

If you hold a Michigan teaching or administration certificate, this course offers two State Continuing Education Clock Hours (SCECHs). To earn this credit, you must complete all of the assigned activities and spend the equivalent of the allocated SCECH credit as you work your way through this course. Visit the Professional Learning Portal SCECH Courses page for further information.

Facilitation

This course is an open entry and open exit course, and is not facilitated. The grading and feedback on activities have been automated to provide you with the ability to work at a pace appropriate to you as you complete your learning. The learning activities are designed to give you formative feedback throughout the course while summative assessments are used to provide you with information about your knowledge and to collect completion data for the course.


If you do need to talk to a human, please reach out to our Customer Care Center.
